answers.answer: Hey there, every female body is different. But its not a ground rule that females with PCOS do not conceive. When you would plan to start your family, you need to keep healthy diet and exercise to try to get pregnant naturally.I can understand how you are feeling as I am in the same boat. But Miracles do happen. Be patient and live with positive attitude.

Pregnancy is definitely possible with PCOS.  I may take us longer to conceive but it IS possible.  Complications would not necessarily be an issue with pcos (besides the possibility of gestational diabetes).  Complications may arise from other issues IF they are going to happen.

question: Hi..I'm 27 years old and my period is iregular since when i was 12 yrs.old and then i was diagnose having PCOS when i was 19 yrs. Old..my question is: IS THERE ANY POSIBILITY FOR ME TO CONCEIVE OR TO GET PREGNANT WITHOUT COMPLICATIONS?pls help...i wanna be mother..im desperately want a child..thanks
title: Iregular period and diagnose having PCOS
